CWEs: CWE-79: Improper Neutralization of Input During Web Page Generation ('Cross-site Scripting')
description: The function is vulnerable to Cross-Site Scripting (XSS) attacks. It directly assigns the 'value' parameter to the 'innerHTML' property of an element without sanitizing it. If the 'value' parameter contains malicious scripts, they will be executed when the HTML is rendered in the browser.
